title: Ceiling with Allegorical Figures and the Arms of Pope Sixtus V (Guerra's outer drawing); Saint Joseph and the Christ Child (Viani's central drawing)
displaydate: outer drawing c. 1587; central drawing after 1690; attachments c. 1700-1725
medium: pen and brown ink with brown wash over black chalk on heavy laid paper (outer drawing); graphite on heavy laid paper (central drawing); gold leaf borders and paper cut-outs adhered to oculi (Talman additions)
dimensions:
center section (octagon): 23.3 x 16.2 cm (9 3/16 x 6 3/8 in.)
Overall (ceiling design): 51.1 x 41.8 cm (20 1/8 x 16 7/16 in.)
mount: 53.3 x 44 cm (21 x 17 5/16 in.)
attribution: Giovanni Guerra and Domenico Maria Viani
creditline: Gift of The Circle of the National Gallery of Art
